title.value: Versatile Energy-Based Probabilistic Models for High Energy Physics
title.justification: Title as it appears at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Versatile Energy-Based Probabilistic Models for High Energy Physics

extractions.description: This paper introduces a multi-purpose energy-based probabilistic model tailored for High Energy Physics (HEP) events at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). The model leverages the flexibility of energy-based models (EBMs) to describe higher-order inter-particle interactions and can be applied to various tasks including event generation, anomaly detection, and classification in particle physics.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical validation through experiments and applications in High Energy Physics.
type.quote: We show that EBMs are able to generate realistic event patterns and can be used as generic anomaly detectors free from spurious correlations. We also explore EBM-based hybrid modeling combining generative and discriminative models for HEP events.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on High Energy Physics applications at the Large Hadron Collider.
name.quote: In line with these advancements, we build a multi-purpose energy-based probabilistic model for High Energy Physics events at the Large Hadron Collider.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of energy-based models (EBMs) for the generative modeling of high-dimensional data in HEP.
name.quote: By mimicking the inter-particle interactions with a self-attention-based transformer, we map the correlations in the detector space to a probabilistic space with an energy function. The energy model is used for the implicit generation of physics events.

name.justification: The paper addresses anomaly detection in HEP using EBMs to identify out-of-distribution events.
name.quote: Since EBMs naturally provide an energy score for each jet, for which the in-distribution samples should have lower scores while OOD samples are expected to incur higher energies.

name.justification: The paper describes the use of EBMs to enhance event classifiers, thereby combining generative and discriminative approaches.
name.quote: We also explore EBM-based hybrid modeling combining generative and discriminative models for HEP events.

name.justification: Energy-Based Models are the core approach discussed and applied throughout the paper.
name.quote: Energy-based Models (EBMs) [38, 3, 46], as a classical generative framework, leverage the energy function for learning dependencies between input variables.
